p: The proteasome inhibitor MG132 has been shown to reduce cytokine levels and improve survival and lung histology in a SARS murine model [ 56]. The authors did not propose a strong explanation for this effect of MG132, but the reported anti-inflammatory [ 96] and anti-viral internalization effects [ 97] of the proteasome inhibitors may be the mechanisms underlying it. Interestingly, MG132 has been used in recent studies to counteract the effects induced by PLP [ 52, 53, 54, 55]. This, taken together with the results in the recentmurine model of DUB-mutated PLP2 in murine hepatitis [ 57], suggests an involvement of PLP.
